name: Queensberry Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: When I arrived I double-parked (as instructed in directions) and checked in. My car was taken away to be parked elsewhere - and brought back as requested.
reviews.title: Everything you could possibly want from a boutique hotel

reviews.text: Receptionist was sweet - and check-in amazingly quick.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was fabulous (same room as are in some of the photographs that have been posted). When I managed to break a glass of red wine whilst in the bathroom the staff dealt with it all promptly and with very good grace and humour. Much appreciated as I was feeling very foolish at the time.
reviews.title: so stylish
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: We stopped at the Queensberry on the14th-15th September.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The directions to the hotel were great and we found it straight away.We arrived early,dropped our bags and went sight seeing.When we came back,we were told we had been upgraded from a delux room to a superior,although when I checked my confirmation when we got home(which I forgot to take with me)I had paid for a superior room so it wasn't really an upgrade.Never mind,the room was lovely, and our luggage was already there.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were all very helpful and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel! Made our weekend in Bath special!

reviews.text: We had dinner in the Olive Tree which I had requested over the internet,unfortunatley,when we got there,they had no record of it but managed to fit us in anyway so it wasn't a problem.The food was fantastic.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.text: Overall,apart from a few minor details,we had a great time at the Queensberry.It's really well located,near all the attractions.The beds are smashing.The only things I was abit fed up about were-no tea and coffee facities-I had read a previous review and taken my own and when we got our car delivered back to us,it had obviously been parked under a tree and the car was covered in sap and needed washing.Apart from that-a great weekend and nice hotel.
reviews.title: Less than delighted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The majority of the reviews of this hotel are right. It's really, really good. We were greeted with a warm and friendly welcome, loved the concierge parking at the end of a long drive and were delighted with our fabulous room and bathroom - which were clean and well appointed - and with windows that open, hooray! The hotel decor is a little tired in places but in a funny way that made it feel more comfortable. On the downside: Yes, there was a lot of street noise out front at the end of the evening. And the lack of facilities to make a hot drink in the rooms is mean, even if the tea and coffee from room service was good and was delivered promptly. Minor details - not enough to spoil a relaxing, luxurious stay. We hope to return (with a teasmade in our luggage?!).
reviews.title: Hope to come back
best choice in bath
reviews.text: Stayed for a second time at the queensberry...by far the best value place for a little luxury in Bath.
Personal service is very welcome...they remember guests, even assigning us the same room on our repeat visit and on check out you are presented with a special offer.
reviews.title: Overpriced and austere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is very nice and the restaurant relaxing, however I have found the service very poor on every occasion...staff not speaking great English, slow service, lack of a sense of welcome..perfunctory. But overall, with a glass or two of wine, you can put up with that. It's competent. And the food is good.
reviews.title: Brilliant First-time Visit to Bath - Thanks to the Queensberry

reviews.text: I have found the street noise very disturbing at night and you should take ear plugs.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel, great service

description: The Queensberry Hotel occupies four Georgian town houeses in the heart of the city.The entire team are dedicated to giving each of our guest's an outstanding experience. Guests can expect excellent standards of service, luxury bedrooms and delicious award-winning food.The Queensberry has held a Red Star rating for exceptional standards of service for ten concecutive years. This accolade is given by The AA, the organisation responsible for allocating star ratings to hotels and guest accommodation.
